document_title: Testicular pain: 12 causes, symptoms, and prevention
subsection_content:
Men should contact their doctor for immediate medical attention if the following symptoms appear: (6)
Sudden, severe pain in the testicles; Testicular pain accompanied by symptoms of nausea, fever, chills or blood in the urine.; Testicular pain is mild but lasts more than a few days.; Tumors or signs of swelling appear around the testicles or scrotum
In particular, sudden, severe testicular pain can be a sign of testicular torsion. This condition requires immediate medical treatment to avoid permanent damage and total organ amputation.
subsection_title: dau tinh hoan.json. When to see a doctor?

In particular, sudden, severe testicular pain can be a sign of testicular torsion. This condition requires immediate medical treatment to avoid permanent damage and total organ amputation.
